instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight ( at first ),
threads.message:
hi this came in with no backlight problem, I have 0v on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> but no short.
12.6v at bothside of fuse, while probing around, i realize, now if Icd is connected, fan would spin a bit, then stop. ( not turning on ) 
but if I remove lcd, fan will spin forever..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight ( at first ),
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at pins 2/3, 4 and 21/22 of J9000; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight ( at first ),
threads.message:
i was measuring until pin 21/22.. diode mode is 0..
immediately realized this is shorted.. inject and poof, solved
thanks a lot..
